description: In 2020 James Lambert reviewed previous theories, and supports derivation from:
Lambert also notes as not supported by evidence:

adjectives.description: bonzer (comparative more bonzer, superlative most bonzer)

entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand, informal) Remarkable; wonderful; excellent; terrific.
examples: To all the earth she gives the soft glad-eye;
She picks no fav′rits in this world o′ men;
She peeps in nooks, where ′appy lovers sigh,
To make their joy more bonzer still; an′ then,
O′er Spadger′s Lane she waves a podgy ′and,
An′ turns the scowlin′ slums to Fairyland.

entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand, informal, obsolete) An excellent person or thing.
